name: Bagpipes
description: A set of pipes connected to a cloth bag.

name: Birdpipes
description: Pan pipes or satyr pipes, also known as the shalm, these are sacred to Lliira and popular with wood elf and wild elf bards.

name: Drum
description: A percussion instrument consisting of cloth or hide stretched over a wooden cylinder.

name: Dulcimer
description: A large drum.

name: Flute
description: A long, thin wood instrument.

name: Glaur
description: Short, curved horns like a cornucopia. Played with valves, glaur sound like trumpets, while those without valves, known as gloon, have a more mournful sound.

name: Hand Drum
description: A double-headed skin drum fitted with handles along its side.

name: Horn
description: A simple wind instrument used for signalling.

name: Longhorn
description: A Faerûnian flute of sophisticated make, found only in areas with skilled artisans, as in great cities or elven enclaves.

name: Lute
description: A commonly used stringed instrument.

name: Lyre
description: A stringed instrument similar to a small harp.

name: Pan Flute
description: A set of pipes often used by satyrs.

name: Shawn
description: A long wind instrument.

name: Songhorn
description: A recorder, a simple type of flute, usually carved from wood.

name: Tantan
description: A tambourine, a popular instrument with halflings and humans south of the Dalelands.

name: Thelarr
description: Also known as a whistlecane, a simple and easy-to-make wind instrument cut from a reed. They are so simple, in fact, that skilled bards frequently make and give them away to children - to the parents' delight or regret.

name: Tocken
description: A hanging set of carved oval bells, usually played with a pair of light wooden hammers (or open handed). They are most common in underground cultures, where the resonant tones can carry.

name: Viol
description: A stringed instrument played with a bow.

name: Wargong
description: A metal gong, traditionally made from a shield, particularly the shield of an enemy. Both goblins and dwarves make and play wargongs, their sound echoing through tunnels in the Underdark.

name: Whistle-Stick
description: A hollow tube similar to an oversized flute used by grung.

name: Yarting
description: A southern instrument from Amn and Calimshan that is a Faerûnian analog to the guitar. Numerous variations have spread across the continent.

name: Zulkoon
description: A complex pump organ that originated with the zulkirs of Thay, who use it in the casting of their spells. It is considered to have a dramatic, but sinister, sound.
